@sentience.note: Sentience assessment is evidence-based and may evolve with new research. When evidence is incomplete, disputed, or low-quality, apply `@precautionary_principle` and treat protection as required.

@suffering.note: Operational thresholds vary by species/context and should rely on welfare indicators (e.g., `@stress_indicators`) and species profiles; uncertainty triggers `@precautionary_principle`.

@welfare.definition: The physical and psychological state of an animal in relation to its ability to cope with its environment and express natural behaviors.
components: Natural behavior expression (ability to perform species-typical behaviors)
@welfare.assessment: Measured through @suffering indicators, @five_freedoms compliance, and species-specific needs.

@nociception.definition: The sensory nervous system's response to potentially harmful stimuli, detected by nociceptors.
@nociception.relationship_to_pain: Nociception is the mechanism; pain is the subjective experience. Nociception can occur without conscious pain, but presence of nociceptors suggests pain capacity.
@nociception.evidence_value: Presence of nociceptors is strong evidence for potential sentience.

@stress_indicators.definition: Measurable biological markers indicating physiological or psychological distress.

thresholds.chronic_stress: Sustained elevation (>24h) or repeated acute episodes

@five_freedoms.definition: Five fundamental welfare requirements for animals under human care.

freedoms.name: freedom_from_hunger_thirst
freedoms.description: Ready access to fresh water and diet to maintain health and vigor

freedoms.name: freedom_from_discomfort
freedoms.description: Appropriate environment including shelter and comfortable resting area

freedoms.name: freedom_from_pain_injury_disease
freedoms.description: Prevention or rapid diagnosis and treatment

freedoms.name: freedom_to_express_normal_behavior
freedoms.description: Sufficient space, proper facilities, and company of animal's own kind

freedoms.name: freedom_from_fear_distress
freedoms.description: Conditions and treatment avoiding mental suffering

@five_freedoms.evolution_note: Can be extended (add freedoms) but not reduced per @protection_asymmetry

@species_profile.definition: Comprehensive documentation of a species' sentience evidence, welfare requirements, and relevant research.

@practice.definition: A human activity that affects animal welfare, subject to ethical assessment.

@ethical_verdict.note: Verdicts are operationalized via `@rule_practice_evaluation` (including proportionality). Use `COMPLEX` for mixed-impact/high-benefit cases with mitigation; reserve `UNETHICAL` for elimination-presumptive cases per Five Freedoms and severe/trivial-benefit logic.

@biological_impact.definition: Measurable effects of a practice on animal biology and behavior.
@biological_impact.evidence_required: Claims about biological impact require evidence per @evidence_based
